template.name: PostgreSQL by Zabbix agent 2
template.description:
This template is designed for the deployment of PostgreSQL monitoring by Zabbix via Zabbix agent 2 and uses a loadable plugin to run SQL queries.
Setup:
1. Deploy Zabbix agent 2 with the PostgreSQL plugin. Starting with Zabbix versions 6.0.10 / 6.2.4 / 6.4 PostgreSQL metrics are moved to a loadable plugin and require installation of a separate package or compilation of the plugin from sources (https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/7.0/manual/extensions/plugins/build).
2. Create the PostgreSQL user for monitoring (`<password>` at your discretion) and inherit permissions from the default role `pg_monitor`: CREATE USER zbx_monitor WITH PASSWORD '<PASSWORD>' INHERIT; GRANT pg_monitor TO zbx_monitor;
3. Edit the `pg_hba.conf` configuration file to allow connections for the user `zbx_monitor`. You can check the PostgreSQL documentation for examples (https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/auth-pg-hba-conf.html).
4. Set the connection string for the PostgreSQL instance in the `{$PG.CONNSTRING}` macro as URI, such as `<protocol(host:port)>`, or specify the named session - `<sessionname>`.
Note: if you want to use SSL/TLS encryption to protect communications with the remote PostgreSQL instance, a named session must be used. In that case, the instance URI should be specified in the `Plugins.PostgreSQL.Sessions.*.Uri` parameter in the PostgreSQL plugin configuration files alongside all the encryption parameters (type, cerfiticate/key filepaths if needed etc.).
You can check the PostgreSQL plugin documentation (https://git.zabbix.com/projects/AP/repos/postgresql/browse?at=refs%2Fheads%2Frelease%2F7.0) for details about agent plugin parameters and named sessions.
Also, it is assumed that you set up the PostgreSQL instance to work in the desired encryption mode. Check the PostgreSQL documentation (https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/ssl-tcp.html) for details.
Note that plugin TLS certificate validation relies on checking the Subject Alternative Names (SAN) instead of the Common Name (CN), check the cryptography package documentation (https://pkg.go.dev/crypto/x509) for details.
For example, to enable required encryption in transport mode without identity checks you could create the file `/etc/zabbix/zabbix_agent2.d/postgresql_myconn.conf` with the following configuration for the named session `myconn` (replace `<instanceip>` with the address of the PostgreSQL instance): Plugins.PostgreSQL.Sessions.myconn.Uri=tcp://<instanceip>:5432 Plugins.PostgreSQL.Sessions.myconn.TLSConnect=required
Then set the `{$PG.CONNSTRING}` macro to `myconn` to use this named session.
5. Set the password that you specified in step 2 in the macro `{$PG.PASSWORD}`.
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/384190-%C2%A0discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-db-postgresql
Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

item.name: Archive: Count of archived files
item.description: Count of archived files.

item.name: Archive: Count of files in archive_status need to archive
item.description: Count of files to archive.

item.name: Archive: Count of failed attempts to archive files
item.description: Count of failed attempts to archive files.

item.name: Archive: Size of files need to archive
item.description: Size of files to archive.

item.name: Get archive
item.description: Collect archive status metrics.

item.name: Count of autovacuum workers
item.description: Number of autovacuum workers.

item.name: Bgwriter: Buffers allocated per second
item.description: Number of buffers allocated per second.

item.name: Bgwriter: Buffers written directly by a backend per second
item.description: Number of buffers written directly by a backend per second.

item.name: Bgwriter: Times a backend executed its own fsync per second
item.description: Number of times a backend had to execute its own fsync call per second (normally the background writer handles those even when the backend does its own write).

item.name: Checkpoint: Buffers written during checkpoints per second
item.description: Number of buffers written during checkpoints per second.

item.name: Checkpoint: Buffers written by the background writer per second
item.description: Number of buffers written by the background writer per second.

item.name: Checkpoint: Requested per second
item.description: Number of requested checkpoints that have been performed per second.

item.name: Checkpoint: Scheduled per second
item.description: Number of scheduled checkpoints that have been performed per second.

item.name: Checkpoint: Checkpoint sync time per second
item.description: Total amount of time per second that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are synchronized to disk.

item.name: Checkpoint: Checkpoint write time per second
item.description: Total amount of time per second that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are written to disk.

item.name: Bgwriter: Number of bgwriter cleaning scan stopped per second
item.description: Number of times the background writer stopped a cleaning scan because it had written too many buffers per second.

item.name: Get bgwriter
item.description: Collect all metrics from pg_stat_bgwriter: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/monitoring-stats.html#PG-STAT-BGWRITER-VIEW

item.name: Cache hit ratio, %
item.description: Cache hit ratio.

item.name: Connections sum: Active
item.description: Total number of connections executing a query.

item.name: Connections sum: Disabled
item.description: Total number of disabled connections.

item.name: Connections sum: Fastpath function call
item.description: Total number of connections executing a fast-path function.

item.name: Connections sum: Idle
item.description: Total number of connections waiting for a new client command.

item.name: Connections sum: Idle in transaction
item.description: Total number of connections in a transaction state but not executing a query.

item.name: Connections sum: Idle in transaction (aborted)
item.description: Total number of connections in a transaction state but not executing a query, and where one of the statements in the transaction caused an error.

item.name: Connections sum: Prepared
item.description: Total number of prepared transactions: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/sql-prepare-transaction.html

item.name: Connections sum: Total
item.description: Total number of connections.

item.name: Connections sum: Total, %
item.description: Total number of connections, in percentage.

trigger.name: Total number of connections is too high
trigger.event_name: Total number of connections is too high (over {$PG.CONN_TOTAL_PCT.MAX.WARN} in 5m)
trigger.description: Total number of current connections exceeds the limit of {$PG.CONN_TOTAL_PCT.MAX.WARN}% out of the maximum number of concurrent connections to the database server (the "max_connections" setting).

item.name: Connections sum: Waiting
item.description: Total number of waiting connections: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/monitoring-stats.html#WAIT-EVENT-TABLE

item.name: Get connections sum
item.description: Collect all metrics from pg_stat_activity: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/monitoring-stats.html#PG-STAT-ACTIVITY-VIEW

item.name: Custom queries
item.description: Execute custom queries from file *.sql (check for option Plugins.Postgres.CustomQueriesPath at agent configuration).

item.name: Dbstat: Hit blocks read per second
item.description: Number of times per second disk blocks were found already in the buffer cache

item.name: Dbstat: Disk blocks read per second
item.description: Number of disk blocks read per second.

item.name: Dbstat: Blocks read time
item.description: Time spent reading data file blocks by backends.

item.name: Dbstat: Blocks write time
item.description: Time spent writing data file blocks by backends.

item.name: Dbstat: Checksum failures per second
item.description: Number of data page checksum failures per second detected (or on a shared object), or NULL if data checksums are not enabled. This metric is available since PostgreSQL 12.

trigger.name: Dbstat: Checksum failures detected
trigger.description: Data page checksum failures were detected on that DB instance: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/checksums.html

item.name: Dbstat: Conflicts per second
item.description: Number of queries canceled per second due to conflicts with recovery (conflicts occur only on standby servers; see pg_stat_database_conflicts for details).

item.name: Dbstat: Deadlocks per second
item.description: Number of deadlocks detected per second.

item.name: Dbstat: Backends connected
item.description: Number of connected backends.

item.name: Dbstat: Number temp bytes per second
item.description: Total amount of data written per second to temporary files by queries.

item.name: Dbstat: Number temp files per second
item.description: Number of temporary files created by queries per second.

item.name: Dbstat: Rows deleted per second
item.description: Number of rows deleted by queries per second.

item.name: Dbstat: Rows fetched per second
item.description: Number of rows fetched by queries per second.

item.name: Dbstat: Rows inserted per second
item.description: Number of rows inserted by queries per second.

item.name: Dbstat: Rows returned per second
item.description: Number of rows returned by queries per second.

item.name: Dbstat: Rows updated per second
item.description: Number of rows updated by queries per second.

item.name: Dbstat: Committed transactions per second
item.description: Number of transactions that have been committed per second.

item.name: Dbstat: Roll backed transactions per second
item.description: Number of transactions that have been rolled back per second.

item.name: Get dbstat sum
item.description: Collect all metrics from pg_stat_database as sums for all databases: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/monitoring-stats.html#PG-STAT-DATABASE-VIEW

item.name: Get dbstat
item.description: Collect all metrics from pg_stat_database per database: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/monitoring-stats.html#PG-STAT-DATABASE-VIEW

item.name: Get locks
item.description: Collect all metrics from pg_locks per database: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/explicit-locking.html#LOCKING-TABLES

item.name: Age of oldest xid
item.description: Age of oldest xid.

item.name: Ping
item.description: Used to test a connection to see if it is alive. It is set to 0 if the query is unsuccessful.

trigger.name: Service is down
trigger.description: Last test of a connection was unsuccessful.

item.name: Get queries
item.description: Collect all metrics by query execution time.

item.name: Replication: Standby count
item.description: Number of standby servers.

item.name: Replication: Lag in bytes
item.description: Replication lag with master, in bytes.

item.name: Replication: Lag in seconds
item.description: Replication lag with master, in seconds.

item.name: Get replication
item.description: Collect metrics from the pg_stat_replication, which contains information about the WAL sender process, showing statistics about replication to that sender's connected standby server.

item.name: Replication: Recovery role
item.description: Replication role: 1 — recovery is still in progress (standby mode), 0 — master mode.

item.name: Replication: Status
item.description: Replication status: 0 — streaming is down, 1 — streaming is up, 2 — master mode.

item.name: Uptime
item.description: Time since the server started.

trigger.name: Service has been restarted
trigger.description: PostgreSQL uptime is less than 10 minutes.

item.name: Version
item.description: PostgreSQL version.

trigger.expression: last(/PostgreSQL by Zabbix agent 2/pgsql.version["{$PG.CONNSTRING}","{$PG.USER}","{$PG.PASSWORD}"],#1)<>last(/PostgreSQL by Zabbix agent 2/pgsql.version["{$PG.CONNSTRING}","{$PG.USER}","{$PG.PASSWORD}"],#2) and length(last(/PostgreSQL by Zabbix agent 2/pgsql.version["{$PG.CONNSTRING}","{$PG.USER}","{$PG.PASSWORD}"]))>0
trigger.name: Version has changed
trigger.event_name: Version has changed (new version value received: {ITEM.VALUE})

item.name: WAL: Segments count
item.description: Number of WAL segments.

item.name: WAL: Bytes received
item.description: WAL receive, in bytes.

item.name: Get WAL
item.description: Collect write-ahead log (WAL) metrics.

item.name: WAL: Bytes written
item.description: WAL write, in bytes.

discovery_rule.name: Database discovery

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Database age
item_prototype.description: Database age.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Bloating tables
item_prototype.description: Number of bloating tables.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Database size
item_prototype.description: Database size.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Blocks hit per second
item_prototype.description: Total number of times per second disk blocks were found already in the buffer cache, so that a read was not necessary.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Disk blocks read per second
item_prototype.description: Total number of disk blocks read per second in this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Disk blocks read time per second
item_prototype.description: Time spent reading data file blocks by backends per second.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Disk blocks write time
item_prototype.description: Time spent writing data file blocks by backends per second.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Checksum failures
item_prototype.description: Number of data page checksum failures detected in this database.

trigger_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Checksum failures detected
trigger_prototype.description: Data page checksum failures were detected on that database: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/checksums.html

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Detected conflicts per second
item_prototype.description: Total number of queries canceled due to conflicts with recovery in this database per second.

trigger_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Too many recovery conflicts
trigger_prototype.event_name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Too many recovery conflicts (over {$PG.CONFLICTS.MAX.WARN:"{#DBNAME}"} in 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The primary and standby servers are in many ways loosely connected. Actions on the primary will have an effect on the standby. As a result, there is potential for negative interactions or conflicts between them. https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/hot-standby.html#HOT-STANDBY-CONFLICT

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Detected deadlocks per second
item_prototype.description: Total number of detected deadlocks in this database per second.

trigger_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Deadlock occurred
trigger_prototype.description: Number of deadlocks detected per second exceeds {$PG.DEADLOCKS.MAX.WARN:"{#DBNAME}"} for 5m.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Get dbstat
item_prototype.description: Get dbstat metrics for database "{#DBNAME}".

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Backends connected
item_prototype.description: Number of backends currently connected to this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Temp_bytes written per second
item_prototype.description: Total amount of data written to temporary files by queries in this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Temp_files created per second
item_prototype.description: Total number of temporary files created by queries in this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Tuples deleted per second
item_prototype.description: Total number of rows deleted by queries in this database per second.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Tuples fetched per second
item_prototype.description: Total number of rows fetched by queries in this database per second.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Tuples inserted per second
item_prototype.description: Total number of rows inserted by queries in this database per second.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Tuples returned per second
item_prototype.description: Number of rows returned by queries in this database per second.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Tuples updated per second
item_prototype.description: Total number of rows updated by queries in this database per second.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Commits per second
item_prototype.description: Number of transactions in this database that have been committed per second.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Rollbacks per second
item_prototype.description: Total number of transactions in this database that have been rolled back.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Num of accessexclusive locks
item_prototype.description: Number of accessexclusive locks for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Num of accessshare locks
item_prototype.description: Number of accessshare locks for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Num of exclusive locks
item_prototype.description: Number of exclusive locks for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Get locks
item_prototype.description: Get locks metrics for database "{#DBNAME}".

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Num of rowexclusive locks
item_prototype.description: Number of rowexclusive locks for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Num of rowshare locks
item_prototype.description: Number of rowshare locks for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Num of sharerowexclusive locks
item_prototype.description: Number of total sharerowexclusive for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Num of shareupdateexclusive locks
item_prototype.description: Number of shareupdateexclusive locks for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Num of share locks
item_prototype.description: Number of share locks for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Num of locks total
item_prototype.description: Total number of locks in this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Get queries
item_prototype.description: Get queries metrics for database "{#DBNAME}".

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Queries slow maintenance count
item_prototype.description: Slow maintenance query count for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Queries max maintenance time
item_prototype.description: Max maintenance query time for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Queries sum maintenance time
item_prototype.description: Sum maintenance query time for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Queries slow query count
item_prototype.description: Slow query count for this database.

trigger_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Too many slow queries
trigger_prototype.event_name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Too many slow queries (over {$PG.SLOW_QUERIES.MAX.WARN:"{#DBNAME}"} in 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The number of detected slow queries exceeds the limit of {$PG.SLOW_QUERIES.MAX.WARN:"{#DBNAME}"}.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Queries max query time
item_prototype.description: Max query time for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Queries sum query time
item_prototype.description: Sum query time for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Queries slow transaction count
item_prototype.description: Slow transaction query count for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Queries max transaction time
item_prototype.description: Max transaction query time for this database.

item_prototype.name: DB [{#DBNAME}]: Queries sum transaction time
item_prototype.description: Sum transaction query time for this database.

item_prototype.name: Application [{#APPLICATION_NAME}]: Get replication
item_prototype.description: Collect metrics from the "pg_stat_replication" about the application "{#APPLICATION_NAME}" that is connected to this WAL sender, which contains information about the WAL sender process, showing statistics about replication to that sender's connected standby server.

macro.description: Maximum number of recovery conflicts for trigger expression.
URI or named session of the PostgreSQL instance.
Maximum percentage of current connections for trigger expression.
Default PostgreSQL database for the connection.
Maximum number of detected deadlocks for trigger expression.
Execution time limit for count of slow queries.
Slow queries count threshold for a trigger.
